flawed_nl_solution:
The total ratio representing the 500 cards is 11+9 = <<11+9=23>>23
The fraction of the total ratio that represents the number of cards that Ellis got is 11/23, and since there were 500 cards, Ellis got 11/23*500 = <<11/23*500=5500/23>>5500/23
If there were 500 cards, and Ellis received 5500/23 cards, Orion received 500-5500/23 = <<500-5500/23=6000/23>>6000/23 cards
The number of cards that Ellis received more than Orion is 5500/23-6000/23 = <<5500/23-6000/23=-500/23>>-500/23 cards.
#### -500/23

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 20, not 23. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
